Synthesis Procedure: The synthesis was carried out in a Teflon-lined acid digestion bomb (23 cm³) under autogenous pressure. React FeCl3·6H2O (2.5 mmol), DABCO (7.5 mmol), H3PO4 (7.5 mmol), n-butanol (3 cm³), and water (7 cm³). Heat the mixture at 180 °C for 3 days. Cool slowly at 10 °C per hour to room temperature. Separate the colorless crystals from a small amount of green material manually.
Justification: The synthesis was carried out in a Teflon-lined acid digestion bomb (23 cm³) under autogenous pressure. The reaction of FeCl3·6H2O (2.5 mmol), 1,4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]octane (DABCO) (7.5 mmol), H3PO4 (7.5 mmol), n-butanol (3 cm³) and water (7 cm³) at 180 °C for 3 d followed by slow cooling at 10 °C h⁻¹ to room temperature produced [HN(CH2CH2)3NH]3[Fe8(HPO4)12(PO4)2(H2O)6] 1 as colourless crystals and a small amount of a green material.

Synthesis Procedure: A thf solution containing CM-TTF was prepared. An acetonitrile solution of Ag(CF3SO3) was added to the CM-TTF solution. The mixture was stirred and filtered. The filtrate was introduced into a glass tube and layered with diethyl ether. The setup was left to stand at room temperature for 1 day to obtain red plate crystals of the complex.
Justification: A thf solution (3 cm3) containing CM-TTF (18.7 mg, 0.04 mmol) was mixed with an acetonitrile solution (1 cm3) of Ag(CF3SO3) (10.3 mg, 0.04 mmol). The mixture was stirred and filtered, and the filtrate introduced into a glass tube and layered with 2 cm3 of diethyl ether. After standing at room temperature for 1 d red plate crystals of complex 2 were obtained.

MOF Name: C9H12CaO10<|>calcium trimesate synthesized by one-pot self-assembly reaction
Synthesis Procedure: Dissolve 2 mmol of trimesic acid in 20 mL deionized water. Add 3 mmol of calcium acetate to form the metal salt of trimesic acid and acetic acid. Stir the mixture at 150 °C until the acetic acid completely evaporates. Add 20 mL ethanol to the crystallizing solution. Obtain white crystals of calcium trimesate from the solution after 12 days.
Justification: 2 mmol of trimesic acid were dissolved in 20 mL deionized water. 3 mmol of metal acetate (calcium or magnesium) were added to form the metal salt of trimesic acid and acetic acid. The mixture was stirred at 150 °C until the acetic acid completely evaporated. 20 mL ethanol were added to crystallizing solution. White crystals of magnesium trimesate were obtained from the crystallizing solution 22 days later and white crystals of calcium trimesate were obtained from solution 12 days later.

Synthesis Procedure: Prepare a mixture of Eu(NO3)3·6H2O (0.1 mmol) and H3L ligand (0.1 mmol, 32 mg). Add DMF (3.5 mL) and water (1.5 mL) to the mixture. Place the mixture in a Teflon-lined autoclave. Heat the autoclave at 100 °C for 48 hours. Gradually cool the autoclave to room temperature. Filter the resulting colorless crystals. Wash the crystals with DMF and water several times.
Justification: "Complexes 1–3 were synthesized by solvothermal reactions of Ln­(NO3)3·6H2O (Ln = La, Eu, and Tb; 0.1 mmol), H3L ligand (0.1 mmol, 32 mg), DMF (3.5 mL), and water (1.5 mL) prepared in a Teflon-lined autoclave at 100 °C for 48 h and then cooled to room temperature gradually. The resulting colorless crystals were filtrated and washed by DMF and water several times."

Synthesis Procedure: Mix Tb(NO3)3·6H2O (0.1 mmol) and H3L ligand (0.1 mmol, 32 mg). Add DMF (3.5 mL) and water (1.5 mL) to the mixture. Place the mixture in a Teflon-lined autoclave. Heat the autoclave at 100 °C for 48 hours. Gradually cool the mixture to room temperature. Filter the resulting colorless crystals. Wash the crystals with DMF and water several times.
Justification: "Complexes1–3were synthesized by solvothermal reactions of Ln­(NO3)3·6H2O (Ln = La, Eu, and Tb; 0.1 mmol), H3L ligand (0.1 mmol, 32 mg), DMF (3.5 mL), and water (1.5 mL) prepared in a Teflon-lined autoclave at 100 °C for 48 h and then cooled to room temperature gradually.The resulting colorless crystals were filtrated and washed by DMF and water several times."
